thread.title: Grammys 2017: Blue Ivy crashes James Corden's live Carpool Karaoke starring Jennifer Lopez and John Legend

author: Ben Travis
title: Grammys 2017: Blue Ivy crashes James Corden's live Carpool Karaoke starring Jennifer Lopez and John Legend
text:
Grammys: Adele halts George Michael tribute after singing out of tune 
That wasn't the only talking point about the Carter family during the awards show. 
Beyonce, who recently announced that she is pregnant with twins, gave a sensuous performance of Love Drought and Sandcastles from her album Lemonade. 
The LP was named Best Urban Contemporary Album, with lead single Formation winning Best Music Video.   
While Adele won Album of the Year with her 2015 LP 25, the British singer gave a shout-out to her idol Beyonce during the acceptance speech and snapped the trophy in half. 
“I can't possibly accept this award,” Adele said. 
“I'm very humble and I'm grateful and gracious but my artist of my life is Beyonce, and the Lemonade album was just so monumental – Beyonce, it was so monumental – and so well thought out and so beautiful and soul-bearing. Grammys 2017: Adele beats Beyonce to album of the year 
“We all got to see another side to you that you don't always get to see. We appreciate that. 
“All us artists here, we f*
